intro: Alpaminia, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many species of bellflowers. The plant features showy, tubular blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Alpaminia typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
